content.description:
Start to the right of

...Ghost

on some positive flake features. Move up on large holds; undercling to reach past a blank spot to a hand jam. Finish on a patina topout.

This has a kind of highball feeling; but it is not hard climbing. There is solid rock the whole way.
content.location: It is on the far right side of the main face.

content.description:
STG climbs a slight overhang on fun, powerful moves over a great landing.

Stand start with a high left hand crimp and right hand three-finger pinch on the large sidepull feature. From there, find a thin right foot, slap a right hand to the sidepull, reach a left hand crimp, dyno to the false lip, then continue up the remaining edges/bumps to reach the top.

The problem shares many of its holds with Samhain. The movement is however very different between the two.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing is good, but there a few rocks surrounding the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face on House of Ill Repute.

content.description:
Samhain ascends a slightly overhung face via edges.

Stand start matched on an edge six feet off the ground. From there, gain a right hand edge, follow to a left hand sidepull-pocket, gain a right hand edge, dyno to the intermediate lip, and work through the upper tiers to reach an easy mantel.

The problem shares many holds from

Sexually Transmitted Ghost

. It is a very different experience between the two though.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there are some rocks present.
content.location: It climbs House of Ill Repute's north face.

content.description: Sit start matched on the good hueco. From there, move up and left to another hueco-dish, establish the feet on the slab, and finish up the remainder for an easy topout.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but there are some rocks just left of where it climbs.
content.location: It climbs the north face of House of Ill Repute.

content.description: Stand start with hand matched high on the sloping shelf. From there, figure out the thin feet, pop up to a good right hand, match, mantle/reach the hueco sidepull, and finish straight up for the topout.
content.protection: A pad will work, the landing is flat and clear, as long as you don't fall to the left.
content.location: It climbs the southeast face on House of Ill Repute.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a great right hand undercling. From there, gain the sloping lip, establish the feet, match at the lip, gain a decent left hand bump, follow to a jug-lip above, establish the feet on the slab, and finish up the remainder for an easy topout.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the northernmost corner of House of Ill Repute.

content.description:
Sit start just left of

East Creek Posse

with any combination of huecos. From there, make a big left hand move to a sloper, then continue straight up the featured arete to reach an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads, but the landing is ....
content.location: It climbs the north face of House of Ill Repute.

content.description:
Fight The Sky climbs a slight overhang on perfect slopers. Rare to the Nine Mile scene.

Stand start with an oblique, right hand crimp and a micro-edge left hand just to the left of it. From there, reach a sloping left hand, set the feet, dyno with the right to a sloping jug, bump the left hand through a sloper to the incut edge, then reach the false lip at the hollow-out, and continue up on good edges/bumps to a reach an easy topout.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is sandy, but there are a few rock present as well.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face on House of Ill Repute.

content.description:
Sit start just right of

Ground Keeps Coming Up

on your choice of huecos. From there, make a big right hand move to a hueco, then move up and left on the featured arete to reach an easy topout.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good and pads well.
content.location: It climbs the north face of House of Ill Repute.

climbs.name: A Different Function of the Larynx

content.description:
Stand start with a massive jug in the middle of the north face. From there, things get "complicated" as the two times it was sent, it was done in two completely different ways.

The first option is to start with the jug and move a left hand to a crimp. From there, situate your feet, and dyno to the next obvious jug 3 feet above.

The second option is less dynamic but incredibly technical. Start the same way, but utilize left hand slopers and pockets and right heel hooks to make your way up to the giant ledge. From there, top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing is good, but there is one rock to be covered.
content.location: Start on the center of the north face on the massive jug rail. The down climb is located on the back and requires moving through a massive pile of old logs.
